pierce.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make a small hole in or through something, using an object with a sharp point
pierce.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Steam the corn until it can easily be pierced with a fork.
Rose underwent emergency surgery after a bullet pierced her lung.
Pierce small holes in the base of the pot with a hot needle.
pierce.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if sound or light pierces something, you suddenly hear or see it
pierce.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The darkness was pierced by the beam from the lighthouse.
A sudden scream pierced the silence.
The menâ€™s lanterns pierced through the dense mist.
pierce.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to force a way through something
pierce.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Leicester rarely threatened to pierce the Manchester United defence.
